- docs/: Human-facing documentation for agents, communication protocol, and project overview.
- src/: Source code for orchestration, tooling, and types.
- tasks/: Per-task directories containing task.json and related test files.
- types/: Type declaration helpers (e.g., markdown.d.ts).
- package.json, tsconfig.json, vitest.config.ts: Build/test configuration.

- src/index.ts: Entry point/export surface for the library (may wire up orchestrator/tools; see code for details in this repo version).

- src/completion.ts: AI completion utilities.

  - getTestPath(root, taskId, featureId)

  - getProjectPath(root, projectId)
  - uuidv4()

  - readFiles(paths: string[]): JSON-stringified map relPath -> content|listing|error.
  - writeFile(path, content): writes text content; creates directories; security checked.
  - renameFile(src, dst): rename/move with security checks.
  - deleteFile(path): deletes file or directory (non-recursive rmdir for directories).

- await readFiles(['README.md', 'src/index.ts'])
- await writeFile('notes/todo.md', '- [ ] item\n')
- await searchFiles('types Task')

  - saveTask(task): void
  - updateTaskStatus(taskId, status): Task
  - blockTask(taskId, reason, agentType, git): Task — sets blocked, commits via git.pushAll.
  - finishSpec(taskId, agentType, git): void — marks spec finished via git.
  - getFeatureFromIndex(taskId, index): Feature|undefined — resolve feature by display index.
  - createFeature(taskId, title, description): Feature — updates indices and task status.
  - updateFeatureStatus(taskId, featureId, status): Feature|undefined
  - updateFeaturePlan(taskId, featureId, plan): Feature|undefined — persists plan (stringified).
  - updateFeatureContext(taskId, featureId, context: string[]): Feature|undefined
  - updateFeatureAcceptance(taskId, featureId, acceptance): Feature|undefined
  - blockFeature(taskId, featureId, reason, agentType, git): Feature|undefined — sets blocked and commits.
  - finishFeature(taskId, featureId, agentType, git): string — updates feature status based on agent and commits.

- setTaskStatusFromFeatures auto-updates task.status based on features.
- Git operations are delegated to GitManager and message content depends on agent type.

- const t = await taskTools.getTask('89257920-...')
- const f = await taskTools.createFeature(t.id, 'Add X', 'Description')
- await taskTools.updateFeatureStatus(t.id, f.id, '~')
- await taskTools.blockFeature(t.id, f.id, 'Needs data', 'developer', git)

3) projectTools (src/tools/projectTools.ts)
- createProjectTools(projectRoot): returns ProjectTools API for project metadata.
  - getProject(projectId): ProjectSpec — loads project spec at getProjectPath(root, projectId).
  - getProjectDir(projectId): string — resolves the project working directory under getProjectsDir(root) + project.path.
  - getTaskIdFromIndex(projectId, index): string|undefined — reverse-lookup task id by display index from project.taskIdToDisplayIndex.

Typical usage:
- const p = await projectTools.getProject('my-project')
- const dir = await projectTools.getProjectDir('my-project')
- const taskId = await projectTools.getTaskIdFromIndex('my-project', 1)

4) testTools (src/tools/testTools.ts)
- createTestTools(projectRoot): returns TestTools API; test files are Python scripts addressed by task/feature.
  - getTest(taskId, featureId): string — reads contents or returns not-found message.
  - updateTest(taskId, featureId, test: string): string — writes test to path from getTestPath.
  - deleteTest(taskId, featureId): string — deletes if present.
  - runTest(taskId, featureId): string — executes python3 on the test file with a 30s kill timeout; returns PASS/FAIL and captured output.

Typical usage:
- await testTools.updateTest(taskId, featureId, 'print("ok")')
- const result = await testTools.runTest(taskId, featureId)

5) chatTools (src/tools/chatTools.ts)
- buildChatTools({ repoRoot, projectId }): returns { tools, callTool } for LLM tool calling.
  - tools: array of ChatTool descriptors (OpenAI function tool format) exposing:
    - list_tasks
    - get_task_reference(reference: '#<task>[.<feature>]')
    - list_files(path)
    - search_files(query[, path])
    - read_files(paths[])
    - write_file(name, content)
  - callTool(name, args): dispatches to composed tool functions from createTools(repoRoot) and helper getTaskReference(), which uses projectTools.getTaskIdFromIndex and taskTools.getFeatureFromIndex.

Typical usage:
- const { tools, callTool } = buildChatTools({ repoRoot, projectId })
- const out = await callTool('list_files', { path: '.' })

- createTools(projectRoot) merges APIs:
  - ...createTaskTools(projectRoot)
  - ...createTestTools(projectRoot)
  - ...createFileTools(projectRoot)
  - ...createProjectTools(projectRoot)
- Resulting object exposes a flat namespace of all tool functions for convenience in chatTools and orchestrator.

Extending Tools
- Add a new toolset file under src/tools/, export a factory createXTools(projectRoot) returning an object of functions.
- Update src/tools/tools.ts to spread ...createXTools(projectRoot) into the composed API.
- If you want the tool callable from chat, add a ChatTool descriptor to tools[] and a case in callTool(name, args) in src/tools/chatTools.ts.
- Follow security patterns: resolve absolute paths using project root, guard with isWithinRoot for filesystem operations, and ensure directories exist via ensureDir.

Tasks Directory Structure
- tasks/
  - <taskId>/
    - task.json: canonical task spec with features and status.
    - tests/ or per-feature test paths as determined by getTestPath in workflowUtils.

Documentation (docs/)
- AGENT_* files describe roles and protocols: Developer, Planner, Tester, Speccer, Contexter.
- AGENT_COMMUNICATION_PROTOCOL.md: General messaging and tool-calling protocols.
- FACTORY_TS_OVERVIEW.md: High-level TypeScript build/process overview.
- FILE_ORGANISATION.md: This file.

Usage Snippets
- Compose tools
  - import { createTools } from 'src/tools/tools'
  - const tools = createTools(process.cwd())
- Read a task, add a feature, and write a file
  - const t = await tools.getTask(taskId)
  - const f = await tools.createFeature(taskId, 'Add login', 'Implement login flow')
  - await tools.writeFile(`features/${f.id}.md`, '# Login\n...')
- Resolve references from chat
  - const { callTool } = buildChatTools({ repoRoot, projectId })
  - await callTool('get_task_reference', { reference: '#1.2' })

Conventions and Notes
- All filesystem operations are project-root-scoped and must not escape the repo.
- Search is keyword-based, space-separated, case-insensitive, and size-limited to 2MB files.
- GitManager is expected to implement pushAll(message) used by task/feature state transitions.
